The instructors of the "Racing Suspension Setup" course are highly experienced professionals with a wealth of knowledge in racing, suspension tuning, and high-performance driving. Here's a brief overview of their backgrounds and experience:

**Lead Instructor: Peter Krause**

* Peter is a professional racing driver and engineer with over 20 years of experience in motorsports.
* He has competed in various forms of racing, including Formula Atlantic, Indy Lights, and Sports Car Racing.
* Peter has also worked as a test driver and engineer for several top-tier racing teams, including a stint as a test driver for a Formula 1 team.
* He has a degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Michigan and has worked as a suspension design engineer for a leading automotive manufacturer.
* Peter has been teaching high-performance driving and suspension tuning for over 10 years and has developed a reputation as one of the most knowledgeable and effective instructors in the industry.

**Co-Instructor: Mike Skeen**

* Mike is a professional racing driver and instructor with over 15 years of experience in motorsports.
* He has competed in various forms of racing, including IMSA, Pirelli World Challenge, and SCCA Pro Racing.
* Mike has worked as a test driver and engineer for several top-tier racing teams and has a deep understanding of suspension tuning and setup.
* He has a degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of North Carolina and has worked as a suspension design engineer for a leading automotive manufacturer.
* Mike has been teaching high-performance driving and suspension tuning for over 5 years and has developed a reputation as one of the most knowledgeable and effective instructors in the industry.

**Co-Instructor: Tom Long**

* Tom is a professional racing driver and instructor with over 10 years of experience in motorsports.
* He has competed in various forms of racing, including IMSA, Pirelli World Challenge, and SCCA Pro Racing.
* Tom has worked as a test driver and engineer for several top-tier racing teams and has a deep understanding of suspension tuning and setup.
* He has a degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Michigan and has worked as a suspension design engineer for a leading automotive manufacturer.
* Tom has been teaching high-performance driving and suspension tuning for over 5 years and has developed a reputation as one of the most knowledgeable and effective instructors in the industry.

All three instructors have extensive experience in racing, suspension tuning, and high-performance driving, and have worked with a wide range of vehicles, from production cars to purpose-built racecars. They have also developed a comprehensive understanding of the theoretical and practical aspects of suspension tuning, which they share with students in the "Racing Suspension Setup" course.

Throughout the course, the instructors provide personalized feedback, guidance, and support to students, drawing on their extensive experience and knowledge to help students achieve their goals.
